alert.note: Alert for Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 1:55PM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY THROUGH EARLY THIS WEEKEND... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Southwest Carbon County to include Dixon...Baggs and Dad. Upper North Platte River Valley to include Saratoga and Encampment. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause very poor visibility in blowing snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
